current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to strengthen Federal-State partnerships in postsecondary education.

Subpart 4 of part A

header.#text:
Federal and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to make incentive grants to States to assist States in—

text.#text: It is the purpose of this subpart for the

providing grants
				to eligible students attending institutions of higher education or
				participating in programs of study abroad that are approved for credit by

providing

to improve

to develop and
				implement practices that result in reduced costs for students; and

providing public
				accountability and consumer information on the performance of institutions of
				higher education operating within the State.

text.#text:
In order to be eligible to receive an incentive grant
				under this subpart, a State shall enter into an agreement with the

Federal funds
				received by the State under this subpart will supplement and not supplant other

				in this subpart.

The State will
				maintain its commitment to affordable higher education as described in

The State will
				fulfill its role in program integrity under

The State has a
				comprehensive plan for public postsecondary education that addresses the
				following:

Measurable goals
				for student outcomes, including enrollment and completion.

Measurable goals
				for college affordability in the State.

Alignment of such
				plan with the workforce and economic development plans of the State.

Alignment of such
				plan with the elementary and secondary education plan for the State.

The postsecondary
				educational needs of unserved and underserved individuals within the State,
				including individuals beyond traditional college age.

The State
				provides for direct, equitable, and active participation by representatives of
				institutions of higher education, including the voluntary participation of
				private, nonprofit institutions of higher education, and other stakeholders in
				the comprehensive planning process.

text.#text:
In order to receive an incentive grant under this
				subpart, the State agency with jurisdiction over higher education, or another
				agency or entity  designated by the Governor or chief executive of the State to administer
				the program under this subpart, shall submit an application to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				contain—

text.#text: An application submitted under

a description of
				how the grant funds will assist the State in meeting its goals for college
				affordability, including measures to minimize tuition increases and measures to
				increase the availability of need-based student aid;

a description of
				how the State will evaluate the effectiveness of such subgrants and how the
				State will disseminate information on promising practices developed as a result
				of such subgrants;

a description of
				how the State will make publicly available a report card on the progress in
				meeting State goals for public postsecondary education; and

a description of
				the stakeholder consultation, including efforts to engage the voluntary
				participation of private, nonprofit institutions, carried out in the
				development of the application.

header.#text:
Payment of
				Federal share of grants

text.#text:
A
				State awarded an incentive grant under this subpart—

shall use grant
				funds to award student grants; and

may use grant
				funds to award subgrants to eligible institutions.

A State awarded an incentive grant under this subpart
				shall establish a program to award grants to students that complies with the
				following:

The program is
				administered by a single State agency.

short-title.#tail: and that is eligible to participate in a program authorized under this title, shall be eligible to participate under this paragraph.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Partnerships for Affordability and Student Success Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Partnerships for Affordability and Student Success Act

text.#text: The program provides that an institution of higher education that had a student who received funds under this subpart at any time beginning on July 1, 2010, through the day before the date of enactment of the

The program
				provides that such grants to students will be in amounts not to exceed the
				student’s cost of attendance per academic year for attendance at an institution of higher education. Such grants, in combination with
				other State or Federal student assistance, shall not exceed the student’s cost
				of attendance in any given academic year.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and by the State.

text.#text:
The program
				provides for the selection of grant recipients on the basis of substantial
				financial need determined under

The program
				provides for the payment of the non-Federal share of such grants from funds
				supplied by such State which represent an additional expenditure for such year
				by such State for grants for students attending institutions of higher
				education over the amount expended by such State for such grants, if any,
				during the second fiscal year preceding the fiscal year in which such State
				initially received funds under this subpart.

The program
				provides that if the State’s allotment under this subpart is based, in part, on
				the financial need demonstrated by students who are independent students or
				attending the institution less than full time, a reasonable proportion of the
				State’s allotment shall be made available to such students.

The program will
				notify students receiving grants under this subpart that such grants are
				Federal-State partnership grants and are funded by the Federal Government and
				the State.

A State awarded an incentive grant under
				this subpart may establish a program to award subgrants to eligible
				institutions that complies with the following:

The program is
				administered by a single State agency.

The program
				provides for the selection of subgrant recipients based on criteria set by the
				State agency.

The program
				provides for subgrants that support activities that will assist the State in
				achieving—

the State’s
				measurable goals for college affordability, including innovative methods for
				reducing costs; and

improved
				workforce outcomes for graduates.

The program
				provides for the dissemination of promising practices developed through
				subgrant activities.

A State awarded an incentive grant under this subpart
				shall provide—

for such fiscal
				control and fund accounting procedures as may be necessary to assure proper
				disbursement of and accounting for Federal funds paid under this subpart;
				and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: functions under this subpart.

for the making of

may amend the reservation of any amount under this subsection, either
				upon approval of an amendment of the application or upon revision of the

				with respect to which such reservation was made. If the

approves an
				upward revision of such estimated cost, the

may reserve the Federal
				share of the added cost only from the applicable allotment (or reallotment)
				available at the time of such approval.

Certain

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on an
				annual basis:

text.#text:
A
				State that desires to receive payments for continuing incentive grants under
				this subpart shall report the following information to the

The State's
				progress in meeting its goals for college affordability, including measures to
				minimize tuition increases at public institutions and measures to increase the availability of
				need-based student aid.

The State’s
				progress in meeting the postsecondary needs of underrepresented or underserved
				populations in the State.

A list of any
				subgrants made to eligible institutions.

The State’s
				report card described in

Each State that receives
				an allotment under this subpart shall report annually to the public on its
				progress in meeting its public postsecondary education goals and comprehensive
				plan for public higher education. Such report shall include—

information, as determined by the State in consultation with stakeholders, on
				workforce outcomes for graduates;

information on
				college costs, including tuition increases, student indebtedness, and the
				availability of need-based aid; and

information on
				the consumer complaints related to the performance of institutions of higher
				education reported to the State in the prior year.

header.#text:
Participation

may require such

Nothing in this subpart, including voluntary

or of a State
